comment: Heavy spices, wood flavor. Oaky smell and finish. Slightly bitter aftertaste.

It's a flavorful whiskey that has a light but stinging after taste. It's not smooth but the aroma is pleasing and something to linger over. As strange as it sounds a slice of lemon does a lot to increase the appeal of this whiskey.
Smooth !!!! Nice to one shot before sleep
I love this Johnnie, spice and wood flavor...
The whiskey to have when Mitch gets back from traveling
Distinct Walker taste with a nice spicy finish.

Cinnamon, clove, and very smooth. It's a wonderful blend but it reminds me of spiced rum and therefore stops me from calling it good scotch. Also I don't think it's worth the price, but would absolutely stock up if it were $30/bottle
Enjoyable, plenty of spice, lovely long lingering finish. Sour and briny in the mouth. Not much peat. Balanced.

Incredible value (about $45) for a balanced, thoroughly drinkable blend. Honey and spice mingle for a unique JW offering that's great on rocks or neat with a few drops of water.  Impressive packaging.
Big nothing for me. If Black Label is the baseline, then this isn't different enough nor is it close enough. It's an airport present that you ain't gonna try, but it may impress the recipient.
Some fun spice in this bottle - has a more rounded taste than stndard Walker, with nutmeg and other notes present. The best of the traveler series.
A little more cinnamon/nutmeg/all spice flavor than Black. Very drinkable.
Average. Too much spice and a sharp flavor. Like a mix of red and black label. Not great
Just an average drink to me, sadly.
As a beginner this whisky has been the first that isn't too overpowering for me to drink neat. I find it goes down very smoothly and doesn't leave an unwarranted alcohol burn in my throat.
Easy drinking whisky. No smoke. Strong honey overtones. Hints of dried fruit. No spice. Short linger. Quite good.
Slight peatyness, smooth, otherwise not much to note.
Very smooth which I liked. Thought I was drinking leather soaked water with liquid smoke.
mildly spicy. sweet notes. nice on the rocks.
mildly spicy. sweet notes. very nice on the rocks.
Light smoke, vanilla, fruit and spices on the nose, smooth vanilla contrasts with biting spices on the palate, spicy, smokey medium finish
Young taste, light caramel and red/dark fruit notes with wood ending notes.
really good and an excellent first drink of scotch for people who don't typically drink scotch. not smokey at all but has some nice spice that isn't overwhelming.
I found this duty free in Istanbul.  It was very smooth and the exotic spices were definitely evident.  Kind of like their black label except sweeter.
Un buen Whisky de coleccion. Se nota la calidad, en nariz no excede el humo, con una buena suavidad en boca, y un final ajustado

Beautiful on the nose. Smoky notes and maybe caramel and almonds. Vanilla is presente but not with strenght. On the palate is mostly spicy but with a fruity flavor behind the spicyness. Sweet, smoky and spicy. There is almost no finish, short lenght.  83 over 100

Neat in a Sutherland tasting glass at Thanksgiving at Uncle Michael Hoo-ha's in Freehold, NJ.  Nose is odd, with some soap and spice notes. Taste is more spicy, with some smoke peaking through. Nah.  12/28/19.
